file_content.text: Any enemy of the Empire is a friend of mine.
Looks like you two made it. And you're Garith, I'm guessing?
They've taken everything from us, and we're the ones who have to take something back. Our planet, our fight.
This village is someone's home. I won't sacrifice it to your bloodlust.
You'll sit, and that's final.
Maybe those turrets can do more damage. Tefani, see what you can do.
We'll support your fight.
One turret-powered energy shield, coming right up.
Are you sure, Master Jedi? Most of these houses won't survive a bombardment.
Head on out, and you'll run straight into the walkers. We'll hold position as long as we can. Go!
You know where the walkers are. Make it slow and painful.
Garith and his men fought bravely to protect us. Whatever you've lost, I promise we'll rebuild.
My children grew up in that house. We hid there from the Empire. And now I hear he could have saved it?
As long as the Blight holds that dam, Bothawui will never be free.
That shield was the only thing keeping our buildings intact. Not enough to kill us, I guess--the Imps have to take our homes, too.
Tefani is the Protectors' chief engineer. He might know how to repair your shield.
Tefani, any suggestions?
Single-story shacks? A few market stalls? I don't see anything here worth saving.
They're just crummy buildings.
You wouldn't.
But your engineer said he could do something about our energy shield. We're all here, so spit it out.
What? Oh, sorry. Still rattled from that landing.
I saw you had some turrets back there. Inside are all the parts I need to get that shield back online.
Those turrets are the only weapons we have. You scrap them to build a shield, what are me and my men supposed to do?
I can handle the walkers on my own. I won't need backup.
Let me take care of the enemy.
It's not about you.
Tefani's found a way to save Vel'lik. Shouldn't you be happy?
Problem, Garith?
Saving Vel'lik isn't the point.
Destroying their weapons? Is this really the best you can do?
It does sound like a bad plan.
Best I can do with this headache, yeah.
If homes destroyed // Then civilians = refugees
I sense a lot of anger in you. You probably shouldn't be armed.
You're not thinking straight, pal. You shouldn't be operating heavy machinery.
I advise against the Protector's plan, Master Jedi. We need every advantage we can get.
The Bothan is thick with rage. He will fight to the death, if you allow it.
Interjection: Already these newcomers show signs of treachery, master. See how the engineer tries to sabotage your assault!
I am not a combat model, master, but surely additional firepower couldn't hurt?
You shouldn't be fighting the walkers anyway. You should take shelter with the civilians.
We've been under Imperial rule for over a decade. Do you know how many villages they've ruined? How many lives?
I don't approve, but I won't stop you. We'll find new homes for these people.
I wash my hands of this.
That's what New Uphrades is for, I guess. I'll see where I can help with the civs.
Sounded plenty clear to me. Turrets are that way. Get to work.
You think they would have stopped at your house? We had to show the Imps what happens when they cross us!
It was my decision to leave your homes unprotected. And I'd do it again.
Blame me, not him.
Anyone want to argue with a Jedi? I didn't think so.
Your hatred for the Empire sounds more... personal, than most.
Why so angry, Garith?
If I'd known it would cause this much damage, I wouldn't have allowed it.
This is a disaster.
Could have, would have, should have.
I did maintenance on that shield for years. Never would have thought of turrets as spare parts.
Ah, it was nothing. Some jumper cables here, a few stripped bolts there....
You want to talk genius, look at this one. Took down a bunch of walkers without breaking a sweat!
It's our duty to protect you from the Empire. And we don't plan to stop here.
No applause necessary.
You'd never know this village was under attack. Looks good as new.
Don't sell yourself short.
Ah, go on. That good, huh?
If we'd left it up to your leader here, the whole village would be rubble.
Your boss almost killed you.
And the Imperials would know never to come close to Vel'lik again.
They think that's the worst the Empire can do. But this village--Vel'lik--it's been lucky.
Republic said you Protectors are here to help civilians. Well, most of us are either in Camp Sovereign, or know someone who is.
...casualty report, Liah'starn region. Incendiary devices continue to produce outstanding results. Ninety-five percent civilian loss in surrounding villages....
Meet "the Blight." Imperial "efficiency" expert. Here to kill as many as he can before the Empire jumps ship. Those walkers were his.
I understand the fight for victory, but our troops can't ignore this.
Where's the Republic?
When it comes to Imperials, I'm a bit of an efficiency expert myself.
He doesn't scare me.
Blight's men control everything from here to Camp Sovereign, including the Bosnar Dam. Huge hydroelectric facility, provides power for half the planet.
Hauled off to Camp Sovereign, all the way in Liah'starn. By the time your troops get there, the Imps will have cleaned house.
It doesn't matter where this camp is. I can tear through the Imperials like jelly.
We don't need troops.
I assume that's not his real name. Unless he's secretly a Sith Lord.
The Blight, huh?
Ever since the Imps came, we've been prisoners on our own world. They tell us where to go, what to do, how to think.
You disobey, you get punished. Or your family gets punished. Locked up in work camps where no one comes out.
Imps opened the dam once years ago. Flooded an entire valley. Now we need to move through the area--and what do you think Blight's men'll do if they see?
Better let them get to it. All of you.
That's because it is.
And your family?
The camp wasn't part of our briefing. Is it still in operation?
Camp Sovereign?
Since the treaty. Imps will keep it running until the end.
Then that's our mission. If you can get us behind enemy lines, we can free Camp Sovereign.
It's not that easy.
An Imperial army's marching on your command center. Some nutjob colonel's about to plow a small village. Which one do you pick?
Colonel Berlo Harlight. We all think Blight suits him better.
My kind of Jedi.
T7 + Jedi = should hurry // T7 = cannot swim
Capturing a Dam 101, right? Master Kiwiiks made that a tough one.
I'm gonna get wet, aren't I?
We'll need coordinates. And emergency oxygen tanks.
If Blight is worth half his rank, he'll have anticipated this. We should be cautious.
Suggestion: Perhaps we could assume the name "Blight" after his men are destroyed. It has a certain resonance.
I knew waterproofing the crew's footwear would come in handy!
This is it? You said you had a Jedi army!
Yeah, so you'd stop yelling at us.
Then I hope you're ready to fight. Civilians are safe underground, but the walkers already took out our energy shield.
That much I can see.
Cleaned house... you mean they'll kill all the prisoners?
That doesn't sound good.
Minute they see Republic flags. It's happened everywhere else.
You'll have to get through the vanguard outside first. Once you're in, head for the dam control room. Whatever happens, don't let it blow.
With due respect, sending walkers against this place seems... excessive.
Why are the Imps even here?
It's not just Vel'lik. These walkers have been hitting villages all over; they avoid military outposts, so they're no one's priority.
The sick prisoners will make it. We'll hold out as long as we have to. Now go!
What are you doing out here? Find the override so we can fire these things!
A lot of those scouts were veteran fighters. Blight and his men will pay.
A Sith Lord... these Protectors must be pretty important, huh?
The Sith's moving too fast! Shoot around her!
Still catching my breath. Maddox can fill you in.
You heard the captain. Don't give 'em a centimeter!
We'll get packing and head out while you've got them busy. Good luck.
Unless we get control of the dam, half of Bothawui will be in the dark and underwater.
I see the problem.
Do we have to pass the dam? Isn't there another way we can reach Camp Sovereign?
Can we go around?
Nothing that wouldn't take months. We're lucky if these prisoners have a week.
A little water never hurt anybody. And anything destroyed by the dam can be rebuilt.
Big deal, another flood.
We're not talking "a little water." We're talking a tidal wave of epic proportions.
Then we need Blight's men out, plain and simple. More your department than ours, Master Jedi.
They're going to blast their way inside. Defensive positions, everyone!
They're trying the other side now! Regroup over there and keep firing!
The Imps'll never stop coming unless we plug that hole. Do something, Jedi!
